material.mattext: In wireless networks, infrared signals are used most often for data communications.
RF signals can pass through walls and other objects while IR cannot.
The Fresnel zone is the dispersal pattern of waves as they travel from sending to receiving antennas.
The Independent Basic Service Set is a wireless network that uses an AP.
The 802.11i standard maps to the WPA2 security protocol.
Which of the following is defined as the maximum departure of a wave from the undisturbed state?
Which of the following is true about RF transmissions?
EM radiation is measured in volts
frequency has an inverse relationship with wavelength
frequency is the distance between waves
cooler objects produce higher-frequency radiation than hotter objects
Which of the following is true about infrared transmissions?
directed IR transmission relies on reflected light
diffused IR transmission requires emitter and detector to be aligned
the intensity of the light pulse indicates the on or off status of each bit
IR transmissions have speeds up to 25 Mbps.
Which of the following pairs represents a medium frequency band and its common use?
In which frequency range are you likely to find WLANs?
What is a potential problem with having too many APs in a given area?
Which of the following is defined as the positive difference in amplitude between two signals?
Which of the following causes of signal loss is defined as differences in density between air masses over distance?
Which term is the measurement of the difference between two signals?
What does a measurement of +3 dB equal in power measured in mW?
What is used to convert an analog RF signal into digital format?
Which type of analog modulation changes the number of waves representing one cycle?
Which binary signaling technique uses a scheme in which zero voltage represents a 0 bit and the voltage for a 1 bit does not drop back to zero before the end of the bit period?
Which digital signal modulation method is a binary modulation technique in which the carrier signals frequency is changed to represent a 1 or 0 bit?
Which RF transmission method uses an expanded redundant chipping code to transmit each bit?
Which wireless transmission method uses a hopping code?
Which of the following tasks does an AP typically perform?
bridges between the wired and wireless network
acts as a hub for a wired network
routes packets from subnet to subnet
What term is given to a device that is designed to generate radio signals, not including those from the antenna?
What is a Basic Service Set?
a group of wireless devices served by a single AP
multiple APs are set up to provide some overlap
a wireless network that does not use an AP
wireless devices set up as a basic ad-hoc network
Which wireless networking standard uses the 2.4 GHz band and has a maximum bandwidth of 54 MBps?
Cosmic objects emit different types of energy, known as _________________ radiation.
A _________________ IR transmission relies on reflected light that can bounce off walls and other objects.
RF transmits a _______________ signal which can change based on the signals voltage and direction.
A wireless _______________ combines management and security into a single appliance and can perform authentication, encryption, intrusion detection, and other functions.
The _____________________ wireless standard will use the 5 GHz band and will provide multistation WLANs with up to 1 Gbps bandwidth.
